DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine efficacy active intervention ( exercise wellness/support intervention ) compare usual care prevention postpartum depression among woman risk depression . The investigator also examine efficacy exercise intervention compare wellness/support intervention postpartum depressive symptom among woman risk depression .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Exercise Wellness Interventions Preventing Postpartum Depression
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study examine efficacy exercise wellness/support intervention prevent postpartum depression . Specifically , 450 sedentary postpartum woman ( 2-6 week postpartum ) history depression prior pregnancy randomize one three group last six month : ( 1 ) telephone-based exercise intervention ; ( 2 ) telephone-based wellness/support intervention ; ( 3 ) usual care . Participants also complete follow-up assessment session 9 month . Participants recruit via online , email , print advertisement . The investigator obtain healthcare provider consent participant prior randomization . The exercise intervention consist theory-based telephone intervention show increase exercise among postpartum woman previous study ( Lewis et al. , 2011 ) . The wellness/support condition schedule exercise intervention address several topic related wellness . The usual care condition receive choice exercise wellness/support condition upon completion final assessment . The primary dependent variable depression measure Structured Clinical Interview DSM-IV Axis I Disorders ( SCID-I ) Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale ( EPDS ) . Exercise adherence assess use 7-Day Physical Activity Recall Interview ActiGraph ( i.e. , accelerometer , objective measure exercise ) .
DOC.criteria: Generally healthy Low active Currently pregnant ( wait randomize postpartum ) less six week postpartum History depression Less 18 year age Preexisting hypertension diabetes Currently exercise ( define exercise 60 minute per week ) Enrolled another exercise weight management study Another member household participate study Unable exercise 20 minute continuously Musculoskeletal problem arthritis , gout , osteoporosis , back , hip knee pain may interfere exercise Exercise induced asthma Any condition would make exercise unsafe unwise Taking medication interfere heart rate response exercise beta blocker Hospitalization psychiatric disorder past six month Current depressive episode ( base SCID ) and/or currently receive antidepressant medication psychotherapy depression ( participant depress prior randomization refer primary physician psychiatrist )
